item.title: ‘I changed my will to deter vultures’: I’m in my 60s and disabled. Do I spend down my assets to qualify for Medicaid?
item.description: “I pay my taxes and insurance, donate money and personal belongings.”

item.title: Fed chief Powell is talking about the U.S. economy again. And Wall Street is all ears.
item.description: Wall Street has been hanging on every word of Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell as stocks charged to record highs. Investors hope he’ll give more cl...

item.title: My former mother-in-law left a $1 million estate. Can I sue my ex-husband for a share of it?
item.description: “My mother-in-law did not leave me anything in her will, but she should have.”

item.title: Lam Research’s stock is having a historic rally. Now a crucial test looms.
item.description: Lam’s stock has soared in recent days on enthusiasm for the memory-chip market. But Micron’s spending forecast tomorrow will put the rally to the test...

item.title: Bitcoin falls while gold reaches new highs. Why that may not bode well for stocks.
item.description: Bitcoin fell while gold rallied on Monday. And it doesn’t bode well for stocks, which are on track for new highs after posting three straight weeks of...
